      • roundDownByLargestPower

        public static float roundDownByLargestPower(float f)
        Round number down to in the largest power. For example, roundDownByLargestPower(3.1) returns 3.0 roundDownByLargestPower(-3.1) returns -4.0 roundDownByLargestPower(31.1) returns 30.0
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • roundUpByLargestPower

        public static float roundUpByLargestPower(float f)
        Round number up to the next digit in the largest power. MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(31.1f) == 40.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(0.11f) == 1.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(-0.011f) == -0.02f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(310.1f) == 400.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(-3.1) == -4.0f; MiscMath.roundUpByLargestPower(3.1) == 4.0f;
        Parameters:
        f -
        Returns:

      • taylor

        protected static double taylor(double number,
                               int n)
        use the taylor series to approximate the natural log of a number. Note that internally, the variable x which is number - 1. ln(1 + x) is computed, so number = 1 + x and therefore x = number - 1; ln(1+x) = x - (x^2)/2 + (x^3)/3 - ...
        Parameters:
        number -
        n -
        Returns:
